qas.question: In 2012 what was the the disturbance with the government running smoothly ? Burma?

answers.text: the number of ongoing conflicts in Myanmar

qas.question: Were any religious groups involved in the scrimmages ?
Were any terrorist groups involved in the Burmese conflicts ?
Does al-Qaeda believe that Muslims in Burma are in danger?

answers.text: Ayman al-Zawahiri said al-Qaeda had not forgotten the Muslims of Myanmar and that the group was doing "what they can to rescue you".

qas.question: Did Muslims in Burma give a repose to statements made by al-Qaeda?

answers.text: the Burmese Muslim Association issued a statement saying Muslims would not tolerate any threat to their motherland.

context: In October 2012 <a0_0>the number of ongoing conflicts in Myanmar<a0_0/> included the Kachin conflict, between the <a1_0>Pro-Christian Kachin Independence Army a<a1_0/>nd the government; a civil war between the Rohingya Muslims, and the government and non-government groups in Rakhine State; and a conflict between the Shan, Lahu and Karen minority groups, and the government in the eastern half of the country. In addition al-Qaeda signalled an intention to become involved in Myanmar. In a video released 3 September 2014 mainly addressed to India, the militant group's leader <a3_0>Ayman al-Zawahiri said <a2_0>al-Qaeda<a2_0/> had not forgotten the Muslims of Myanmar and that the group was doing "what they can to rescue you".<a3_0/> In response, the military raised its level of alertness while <a4_0>the Burmese Muslim Association issued a statement saying Muslims would not tolerate any threat to their motherland.
